Package io.github.zero88.jooqx.mutiny

Interface SQLPlainExecutor

  • public interface SQLPlainExecutor
    Represents for a DDL executor that executes batch SQL command

    NOTE: This class has been automatically generated from the original non Mutiny-ified interface using Vert.x codegen.

      • sql

        @CheckReturnValue
io.smallrye.mutiny.Uni<java.lang.Integer> sql​(java.lang.String statement)
        Execute the plain SQL statement without result (e.g: SET, INSERT, UPDATE, etc...)

        Unlike the bare Vert.x variant, this method returns a Uni. Don't forget to subscribe on it to trigger the operation.

        Parameters:
        statement - the plain SQL statement without result
        Returns:
        the uni firing the result of the operation when completed, or a failure if the operation failed.

      • sqlAndAwait

        java.lang.Integer sqlAndAwait​(java.lang.String statement)
        Blocking variant of sql(String).

        This method waits for the completion of the underlying asynchronous operation. If the operation completes successfully, the result is returned, otherwise the failure is thrown (potentially wrapped in a RuntimeException).

        Parameters:
        statement - the plain SQL statement without result
        Returns:
        the Integer instance produced by the operation.

      • sqlAndForget

        void sqlAndForget​(java.lang.String statement)
        Variant of sql(String) that ignores the result of the operation.

        This method subscribes on the result of sql(String), but discards the outcome (item or failure). This method is useful to trigger the asynchronous operation from sql(String) but you don't need to compose it with other operations.

        Parameters:
        statement - the plain SQL statement without result
